page.title: 15GRID SQUARE TWELVE
page.content: { Ashington Veterans Institute and Area Ashington Veterans Institute was formed in 1938. It has about 93 members and the recreation available is pool, snooker, cards, dominoes and similar games. Other things in the grid include a Mineral Railway Line, Government Buildings which include an Unemployment Benifit Office, Probate Office, Probation Office, Womens Royal Voluntary Service, Local Tribunal Office. These buildings were adapted from living accomodation used by displaced workers after World War Two. Also nearby is a large area used as allotments (small garden plots) used for kitchen produce or the keeping of pigeons and domestic poultry. Nearby there is some buildings which used to belong to the colliery for stables for the pit ponies, but they are now used for workshops.
